title: How to restore my tabs on my initialized laptop
content:
I logged out of my Firefox account, then reformatted my PC.

After reinstalling Windows 11, I installed Firefox on the PC computer.

When I signed in to Firefox, I expected to see my saved tabs just like I had seen them before. There is no sign of any of my previous tabs.

All my previous Shortcuts and Bookmarks are all fine.

How do I restore the previous tabs?
creator: nlogies

title: Vertical Tab Groups
content: I use vertical tabs and the new tab group feature which allows you to assign a group heading for 1 or more tabs. When I right click on a tab I can create a new tab group. Below this option is a button labeled "Closed Groups". If I want to use one of these and check it, the tab I want to assign to it is closed and the group name is not listed in the sidebar. It seems the "Closed Groups" can no longer be used. There is no way to get rid of them and I end up creating duplicates as new tab groups with the same names. I want to either delete the Closed Groups or be able to reuse them. Any solution for this problem?
creator: matloffm

title: FireFox running on POP_OS
content:
What settings should I use to get the chat window to work on FireFox. The website is https://system76.com. I login and try to use the chat feature and it does not work. The chat feature does work on Chrome. I tired allowing notifications in Firefox settings, but that did not work. Are their any other setting should try?

I checked the box Allow Firefox to automatically apply exceptions required to avoid major website breakage and it worked, but I don't understand how this selection affects overall security.
creator: edward.cheadle8
